description: Slow cooked whole butter chicken, skin and fat removed, added to a spicy lentil and vegetable soup.
name: Slow Cooked Butter Chicken Soup Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 200g carrots, peeled and sliced in thin strips
200g celery, washed and sliced into thin strips
200g white of leek, washed and sliced into thin strips
2 roasted red capsicum, peeled and sliced into thin strips
0.25 bunch fresh chopped coriander, well washed
2 tsp methi leaves, washed and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Split chicken in half down the backbone and place in a bowl cover with the 3 tablespoons of tandoori mixed with coriander powder, cumin, garam masala dried chilli and 100g of the coconut cream, using it all and coating it well, then sprinkle with the thai basil.
Cover tightly with cling wrap and leave to marinate overnight.
Place chicken skin side down in a Dutch oven preferably enameled cast iron but anything will work. On the lowest light possible cook for 3 hours or until the meat is falling off the bone.
Leave to cool and then remove all the bones and skin keep meat aside and put in fridge while making the soup.
Assemble your vegetables to finish making the soup.
Get all other ingredients ready to add.

In a large thick based pot or enameled cast iron Dutch oven, put one tsp of olive oil. Throw the carrots, onion and celery in and let them cook on low light for a few minutes to saut√© and cook, but please do not overcook as the slightly al dente texture really adds to this soup!
Next throw in the zucchini's and red capsicum.
Add the chicken stock, garlic, ginger, garlic, lemon and lime juice and lemon zest. Replace the lid and cook for a further 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and all the chicken, 2 tablespoon extra of tandoori paste and 100ml extra of coconut cream and heat through with the lentils.
Just before serving, stir through all the fresh herbs and adjust seasoning.
